name: captaincy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the position of captain (= leader) of a sports team: He made a sudden decision to give up the captaincy. The captaincy for an international match is a great honour.
(also Captaincy) the position of captain of a ship or an aircraft: I got my aircraft captaincy very early. Such knots can also indicate Captaincy of a ship.
(also Captaincy) the position of captain (= an officer's rank) in the British army or navy, or in the US air force, Marine Corps, Coast Guard, or the US police and fire departments: A grammar school education and a captaincy in the army made him what he is. Under the Captaincy of Fred Beadle, the fire brigade responded to many emergencies. See
captain
More examplesFewer examplesShe lost her captaincy of the volleyball team. He will bring the same intensity to his captaincy that he brought to the team as a player. The captaincy of an aircraft carrier calls for skills far different from the captaincy of a sailing vessel.In 1756 he was promoted to a captaincy of marines.
